name: Youtube Feathery
description: Minimal YouTube interface, inspired by the feather beta option that used to be available on YouTube. Cuts video pages down to displaying just the player and description text. Stylesheet is very basic, so the average user with little fluency in CSS can modify it easily.
additional_info:
What it does:
- Blocks unnecessary elements using the display property.
- Sets masthead and page background colors to grey (compare to default page background color).
- Removes boxes surrounding the video description and title.

What it doesn't do:
- It doesn't emulate YouTube feather, the only similarity is that it trims the fat off.
- It doesn't necessarily prevent the elements from loading, so your page loads will still probably take just as long.

If you'd like some page element back: 
1.) Go to Firefox > Add-Ons > User Styles > Edit
2.) Read the comments /* that look like this */ and find the element you want back.
3.) Delete the line or group of lines directly below that comment.
4.) Click "Save"
5.) Reload affected page.

See: https://userstyles.org/styles/120752/youtube-minimal-junk
if you'd like something in the same vein, but a bit more usable.
